TEXT.English: Military units in cities increase happiness
Increased maintenance from number of cities; specialists produce food if city works less than nine tiles

[TAB]Oligarchy describes the rule by a small elite, as opposed to the rule of a single dictator or the majority of the population. This could apply to the Roman "Republic" just as well as to a significant part of the history of the "Holy Roman Empire" or China post Mao.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Oligarchy describes the rule by a small elite, as opposed to the rule of a single dictator or the majority of the population. This could apply to the Roman "Republic" just as well as to a significant part of the history of the "Holy Roman Empire" or China post Mao.

TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Oligarchy describes the rule by a small elite, as opposed to the rule of a single dictator or the majority of the population. This could apply to the Roman "Republic" just as well as to a significant part of the history of the "Holy Roman Empire" or China post Mao.

TEXT.English: Increases great general emergence; enables drafting; extra happiness from barracks; more Espionage; Double Production for Jail
Commerce from Specialists; cottages, hamlets and villages develop faster; more culture
Extra experience for all units; extra commerce from forts; extra happiness from castles; extra stability from vassals; can train Knights
May hire double the amount of statesmen; increased happiness in six largest cities; build courthouses faster
Extra espionage from specialists; less war weariness; more military production; no stability penalty for conquered cities or from minority cultures
[ICON_BULLET]No stability penalty for conquered cities or minority culture
May hire double the amount of artists, scientists and merchants; unhappiness penalty for all civilizations without egalitarianism; higher Great People Birth Rate
The most primitive Society civic; less health and more maintenance in all cities
Can sacrifice city population to finish production
TEXT.French: Permet de sacrifier la population de la ville pour achever la production en cours.
TEXT.German: Opfert Bevölkerung, um die Produktion zu beschleunigen.
TEXT.Italian: Possibilità di sacrificare la popolazione cittadina per completare la produzione
TEXT.Spanish: Se puede sacrificar población de la ciudad para terminar la producción.

TEXT.English: Extra production from pastures; extra commerce from farms
Increased commerce in all cities; food and production from trade routes; can spend gold to finish production of buildings

[TAB]Socialism describes a society in which the means of production are owned by the workers. In an ideal society everybody would voluntarily do their part to contribute to the greater good, regardless of personal profit. Anarchist Catalonia, the Paris Commune and Zapatist controlled Chiapas are historical examples of such a way of life.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Socialism describes a society in which the means of production are owned by the workers. In an ideal society everybody would voluntarily do their part to contribute to the greater good, regardless of personal profit. Anarchist Catalonia, the Paris Commune and Zapatist controlled Chiapas are historical examples of such a way of life.

Anarchist Catalonia, the Paris Commune and Zapatist controlled Chiapas are historical examples of such a way of life.

Anarchist Catalonia, the Paris Commune and Zapatist controlled Chiapas are historical examples of such a way of life.

TEXT.English: Research from specialists; production from towns; less unhappiness and unhealth
The most primitive economy civic; less health and more maintenance in all cities
Extra production from workshops and watermills; extra unhappiness from banks; double production speed for forges, markets and grocers

No additional income from foreign trade routes; +50% income from trade routes to and from capital; extra commerce from workshops, plantations and slave plantations; double production speed for customs houses; reduced expansion penalty for overseas colonies
Extra trade route in all cities; increased corporation commerce
More production in all cities; extra food from workshops; may hire double the amount of engineers; double production speed for factories, coal plants and industrial parks
Food from towns; extra gold from specialists; double production speed for hospitals and universities
The most primitive religion civic; extra unhappiness from non-state religions
No state religion; extra unhappiness from non-state religions; extra happiness from pagan temples; can build classical wonders
Extra unhappiness from non-state religions; cities with state religion construct buildings faster

May hire double the amount of priests; extra happiness from state religion; extra unhappiness from non-state religions; cities with state religion give extra experience and train units faster; no spread of non-state religions
Can build missionaries without monasteries; increases great people birth rate in cities with state religion
No state religion; increases science in all cities; can build wonders that require a state religion
[ICON_BULLET]Can Build All Wonders that Require a State Religion
The most primitive military civic; extra experience when fighting within own borders; double production speed for walls
Can spend gold to finish production of units; hurried units start with the mercenary promotion; less war weariness
Lower unit support costs; military units produced with food; double production speed for castles
Extra experience and production for land units; extra production from forts; double production speed for barracks and stables; enables drafting
Extra experience and prodcution for naval units; extra production from fishing boats and high sea fishing boats; double production speed for drydocks
Increased war weariness; extra trade income from trade routes with defensive pact partners; increased upkeep for military units
